author: tangymanchurian
content:
<@&857649635274915900> Gossipsub uses the first 20bytes of hash of the message data (decompressed/compressed) as `message-id`. `message-id`  is the only context peers have to obtain new gossip that they don't already have or want. Historically, the protocol has limited each topic/subnet to a message payload of common interest for everyone subscribed to the topic/subnet. 

In the case of danksharding, however, there might be multiple custody columns/rows distributed in the same subnet and not all subscribers would be interested in all columns/rows distributed. Would it in this case make sense to add some context to the `message-id`? Can this problem be circumvented in some-other way (like playing around with the custody requirement size and the number of columns/rows)?

author: sibkatya
content:
I guess you mean this part of the specs
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/_features/eip7594/p2p-interface.md#data_column_sidecar_subnet_id

author: sibkatya
content: Looks like peers are subscribed for the subnets they need

author: sibkatya
content: the devs played a lot with the custody requirement size on the calls üòÅ

author: tangymanchurian
content: True that. Usually there is one subnet assigned for one message type (one column in the case of peerDAS). And I'm not sure if having 1024 subnets for full danksharding will be a problem or not

author: tangymanchurian
content: Is there a limit to how many subnets we can have on the gossipsub network?

author: sibkatya
content: I guess 32, as the number of columns for now

author: sibkatya
content: There are also notes from Peerdas breakout rooms

author: agnxsh
content: What you suggest in the second paragraph is indeed something that needs to be considered for 2 dimensional peerDAS. As of now, as we‚Äôre using subnet sampling, it‚Äôs one DataColumnSidecar per subnet.

author: agnxsh
content: Also did you check out the type called DataColumnIdentifier from the spec? I believe you are referring to something similar. If I don‚Äôt fail to understand. üôÇ

author: agnxsh
content: Which means, as per alpha 6 of CL specs Number of Columns == Data Column Sidecar Subnet Count
